intro: Stemodia chilensis, commonly known as Chilean stemodia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a creeping, herbaceous stem with small, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the spring and summer months. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in sandy or well-drained soils.
